title: bitpunkzy
author: bitpunkzy
created_time: May 08, 2024, 11:55:18 PMLast edit: May 09, 2024, 04:45:15 PM by bitpunkzy
content: Hello, I am conducting research on the historical date for Bitcoin and would like to provide the resultsdata for discussion, how correctly am I reasoning? I need this data for various types of analysis,for example, like Gann, cyclic, etc.I do not take into account the registration date of the bitcoin.org website (08/18/2008) and the white paper (10/31/2008)and I start from the moment the Bitcoin emission began, namely from 01/03/2009, we have the first data on the sale from Martty Malmi(https://twitter.com/marttimalmi/status/423455561703624704)where he created an exchange office with the name NewLibertyStandart on 10/05/2009 and already on 10/12/2009 he already made the first sale of 5050 bitcoinsat a price of 5.02   -   1฿ ~ 0.00099406$the NLS date in the webarchive ends on 03/02/2010 and the following data from the bitcoinmarket.com exchanger from the date (05/25/2010) to the mtgox date, further questions to the dataI don’t have it, but there is no data between 03/02/2010 and 05/25/2010 and historical snapshots in the web archive from bitcoinmarket, which makes it difficult to confirm the date, maybeHas anyone seen NLS data between 03/02/2010 and 05/25/2010?in addition, I received from the blockchain and added to the chart the volumes of movements in the Bitcoin blockchain during the day, with the exception of rewardsper block, and did not exclude returns, and we see that there were movements in 2009, we will not delve into address statistics and other detailsbut let’s just visually analyze and try to guess whether any of these transactions could be real sales,if Martty Malmi could tell us a little about how many transactions there could have been during this period, for 2010 I have no questions, it shows not onlyan increase in movements, as well as a crazy bullrun when the price soared by 290% from a price of 0.00072 to 0.002828, I wonder what caused the price increase?In total we have withblock 1 - 01/03/2009NoNe - but I will put 0.0001 so that we have the first date defined,start NLS 05/10/2009 - 02/03/2010https://web.archive.org/web/20091229132610/http://newlibertystandard.wetpaint.com/page/Exchange+Ratehttps://web.archive.org/web/20100129103612/http://newlibertystandard.wetpaint.com/page/Exchange+RateNoNe - but I will fill them with site data https://bitcoin.zorinaq.com/price/05/25/2010 bitcoinmarket startstart mtgox 07/17/2010Some pictures:And some data =)https://github.com/xpnkz/bitcoin_history_data/blob/main/transactions-btc-in-out-2009-2010.csvhttps://github.com/xpnkz/bitcoin_history_data/blob/main/btcusd1d-2009-2010-blk-vol.txt

comments.body: Quote from: bitpunkzy on May 08, 2024, 11:55:18 PMHello, I am conducting research on the historical date for Bitcoin and would like to provide the resultsdata for discussion, how correctly am I reasoning? I need this data for various types of analysis,for example, like Gann, cyclic, etc.I do not take into account the registration date of the bitcoin.org website (08/18/2008) and the white paper (10/31/2008)and I start from the moment the Bitcoin emission began, namely from 01/03/2009, we have the first data on the sale from Martty Malmi(https://twitter.com/marttimalmi/status/423455561703624704)where he created an exchange office with the name NewLibertyStandart on 10/05/2009 and already on 10/12/2009 he already made the first sale of 5050 bitcoinsat a price of 5.02   -   1฿ ~ 0.00099406$the NLS date in the webarchive ends on 03/02/2010 and the following data from the bitcoinmarket.com exchanger from the date (05/25/2010) to the mtgox date, further questions to the dataI don’t have it, but there is no data between 03/02/2010 and 05/25/2010 and historical snapshots in the web archive from bitcoinmarket, which makes it difficult to confirm the date, maybeHas anyone seen NLS data between 03/02/2010 and 05/25/2010?in addition, I received from the blockchain and added to the chart the volumes of movements in the Bitcoin blockchain during the day, with the exception of rewardsper block, and did not exclude returns, and we see that there were movements in 2009, we will not delve into address statistics and other detailsbut let’s just visually analyze and try to guess whether any of these transactions could be real sales,if Martty Malmi could tell us a little about how many transactions there could have been during this period, for 2010 I have no questions, it shows not onlyan increase in movements, as well as a crazy bullrun when the price soared by 290% from a price of 0.00072 to 0.002828, I wonder what caused the price increase?In total we have withblock 1 - 01/03/2009NoNe - but I will put 0.0001 so that we have the first date defined,start NLS 05/10/2009 - 02/03/2010https://web.archive.org/web/20091229132610/http://newlibertystandard.wetpaint.com/page/Exchange+Ratehttps://web.archive.org/web/20100129103612/http://newlibertystandard.wetpaint.com/page/Exchange+RateNoNe - but I will fill them with site data https://bitcoin.zorinaq.com/price/05/25/2010 bitcoinmarket startstart mtgox 07/17/2010Some pictures:https://github.com/xpnkz/bitcoin_history_data/blob/main/transactions-btc-in-out-2009-2010.csvhttps://github.com/xpnkz/bitcoin_history_data/blob/main/btcusd1d-2009-2010-blk-vol.txtReposting this so people can see your photos since you are a newbie account.It’s interesting research you did. I also heard that the Liberty was the first bitcoin exchange and pretty crazy how someone bought 5050 BTC for only $5.It’s also interesting how this exchange launched in 2009, didn’t think it existed that early. At the time there was maybe only like a few thousand people who used bitcoin.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: adaseb, you can have more information on the first Bitcoin exchange with my topic.Do you know a first Bitcoin exchange? What is it, How it looks like?Early trades of Bitcoin are funny and very classic, bitcoins for pizza, honey pots, and more.theymos used to trade his bitcoins with very low prices.13 years ago Theymos sold 160btc at $0.003 per 1, lowest price ever recorded

Do you happen to know more about the evolution of Bitcoin trading platforms since then?

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: bitpunkzy on May 09, 2024, 04:54:28 PMthanks interesting, I wonder in which block theymos was selling, because on his public address the first transaction was 07/25/2010 https://www.blockchain.com/ru/explorer/addresses/btc/1NXYoJ5xU91Jp83XfVMHwwTUyZFK64BoADWe never know.Because theymos is as same as Satoshi Nakamoto and all of us, can have many Bitcoin wallets and addresses.Many researchs, analyses try to identify how many bitcoins Satoshi Nakamoto has but it is all estimations, not correct number. With later Bitcoin adopters and users like theymos, it is harder to identify their addresses because with time, there are more Bitcoin users, addresses and transactions.

comments.body: Quote from: tranthidung on May 09, 2024, 05:22:43 PMQuote from: bitpunkzy on May 09, 2024, 04:54:28 PMthanks interesting, I wonder in which block theymos was selling, because on his public address the first transaction was 07/25/2010 https://www.blockchain.com/ru/explorer/addresses/btc/1NXYoJ5xU91Jp83XfVMHwwTUyZFK64BoADWe never know.Because theymos is as same as Satoshi Nakamoto and all of us, can have many Bitcoin wallets and addresses.Many researchs, analyses try to identify how many bitcoins Satoshi Nakamoto has but it is all estimations, not correct number. With later Bitcoin adopters and users like theymos, it is harder to identify their addresses because with time, there are more Bitcoin users, addresses and transactions.thank you, in this study, I am not interested in who has how much money and who has how many wallets, I am interested in the date and price of the sale =) but if there is no price, then at least the volume =) where we can potentially allow for the possibility of a change of owner, I offer you data on movements in blocks, you can find it at the link ..https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xpnkz/bitcoin_history_data/main/transactions-btc-in-out-2009-2010.csv

comments.author: bitpunkzy
comments.body: Quote from: Tyke on May 09, 2024, 05:46:42 PMBitcoi. History book:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5491132.0thank you for your response, I express my respect, I read your research, and even translated it into Russian and posted it on my Telegram channel (https://t.me/s/bitpunkz/188), citing your authorship, but with the book as You can’t work with a dataframe, and you can’t try functions on it, I’m putting together a dataframe for analysis. you can see what happens, maybe later I will add this data as a tradingview indicator..

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Hmm, OP nice piece of compilation, there are some interesting facts as well, keep it up any way I would like to suggest you that make sure to post the trading-related threads in the trading discussion thread because I cant find any interesting topics like this on that section even though this topic also belongs to that section if some of the more threads like this starts a trend there it will be great to discuss such type of topics there in more depth haha on typical trading scale.
